abstract_ssm: Richard Berkowitz (b. 1955) is a gay American author, AIDS activist, and a former sex worker.  In 1983, Berkowitz and Michael Callen wrote the first safe sex guide, How to Have Sex in an Epidemic: One Approach.   Berkowitz continued to write about and advocate for safe sex through the 1980s into the 2000s.  The Richard Berkowitz Papers date from 1944 to 2015, with the bulk being between 1982-2015, and document his work as a writer, AIDS activist, and sex worker, as well as his family, his education, his medical history, and Daryl Wein's documentary about Berkowitz's life, Sex Positive.  The papers contain correspondence,  manuscripts, published material, clippings, programs, photographs, a scrapbook, audiovisual material, and a website.
